newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean steel shares rise on world price recovery.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean steel shares rise on world price recovery.

text.p: Shares of South Korea's steelmakers rose in Monday's morning trading as investors believed rising prices in the world steel industry would boost corporate earnings, brokers said.
The iron and steel sub-index rose 23.18 points, or 1.67 percent, to 1,405.61.
Brokers said investors were pinning their hopes on further rises in steel product prices.
Choi Dong-chul of Ssangyong Securities said hopes for a recovery in the world steel industry boosted POSCO. The steelmaker added 1,100 won to 55,100.
Dongkuk Steel rose 600 won to 20,600 and Inchon Iron and Steel gained 100 won to 15,600.
Peter Lee, a steel analyst at Dongbang Peregrine Securities, said steel product prices in the first quarter rose an average of three to five percent from the fourth quarter of 1996.
But steel analysts questioned how long the price rise would continue.
"I'm not quite sure whether it is a long-term cycle or a mid-term cycle," said an analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell Capital Markets Ltd.
Lee forecast the price would weaken from the third quarter after some steelmakers expanded their production capacity.
